description: The Scaling API provides API for adding cluster level scaling rules, triggers and event listeners

set-trigger.description: The set-trigger command allows you to add and update triggers on various system metrics

event.description: The event type on which to set a trigger

waitFor.description: The amount of time to wait after the trigger condition is satisfied before trigger is activated

lowerBound.description: The lower bound of the condition below which the trigger is activated

upperBound.description: The upper bound of the condition below which the trigger is activated

actions.description: The actions to be performed in sequence when the trigger is activated

name.description: The name of the trigger to be removed

removeListeners.description: If true, all listeners of this triggers are deleted together with the trigger

set-listener.description: The set-listener command lets you add a listener to a trigger

trigger.description: The name of the trigger to listen to

stage.description: The stage of the trigger for which to listen

beforeAction.description: The name of the action before which the listener should be notified

afterAction.description: The name of the action after which the listener should be notified

class.description: The listener class to be notified once the given stage of the given trigger is activated

name.description: The name of the listener to be removed

suspend-trigger.description: Pauses a trigger until an explicit resume is invoked or if the optional timeout expires

name.description: The name of the trigger to be suspended or '#EACH' to suspend all triggers

timeout.description: Optional timeout after which all triggers are resumed automatically

name.description: The name of the trigger to be resumed or '#EACH' to resume all triggers

set-policy.description: The set-policy command allows you to add and update policies that apply to collections

set-cluster-policy.description: The set-cluster-policy command allows you to add and update cluster-level policy that acts as the base for all collection level policies, if any

set-cluster-preferences.description: The set-cluster-preferences command allows you to add and update cluster-level preferences that are used to sort nodes for selection in cluster operations

name.description: The name of the policy to be removed

set-properties.description: The set-properties command allows you to add and update properties used by autoscaling framework itself
